Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Leon J Gordon, United Apostolic Church located at 205-24 Hollis Avenue, St. Albans NY 11412.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Williams.

The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Leon J. Gordon, United Apostolic Church located at 205-24 Hollis Avenue, St. Albans N.Y. 11412.

On behalf of Council Member Williams, Council Member XXXXXX moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the record..

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Marte:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 19-160.2 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving a sidewalk café located at 37 Canal Street, New York, NY 10002 Borough of Manhattan, Council District 1, Community District 3, related to Application No. D 2550119000 SWM (Le Dive) shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Le Dive, Manhattan (D 2550119000 SWM).

Items.Title: Coupled on General Orders Calendar

Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, and the Governor to sign, A5658A/S378, which directs the New York State Education Department and the New York State Office of Children and Family Services (OCFS) to prepare posters and pamphlets to ensure that foster youth are made aware of the higher education financial resources available to them
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Children and Youth
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: NYSED and the New York State Office of Children and Family Services (OCFS) to prepare posters and pamphlets to ensure that foster youth are made aware of the higher education financial resources available to them (A5658A/S378).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation providing for annual adjustments to the rental and carrying charges for Mitchell-Lama developments based on increases in the Consumer Price Index.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally noted his intention to vote negative against this item: 
Council Member Epstein.




Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Providing for annual adjustments to the rental and carrying charges for Mitchell-Lama developments based on increases in the Consumer Price Index.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 47 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

Previous to the commencement of these proceedings, Harvey D. Epstein was sworn-in as the newly elected Council Member representing the 2nd Council District (Manhattan).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of  Thursday, December 18, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The Speaker (Council Member Adams) moved that the following override items be voted separately and before the remaining items coupled on the General Orders Calendar:

Int. No. 982-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 40-7-0
Negative:Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 984-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 40-7-0
Negative: Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 1248-B,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 46-1-0
Negative: Council Member Holden.

Int. No. 1372,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 40-7-0
Negative: Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).



During the General Orders vote, the remaining items coupled on the General Orders Calendar received the vote of 47-0-0. 



The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:









See files for individual votes.
